summary.para: Clears all of the rendering resources used by Direct2D.

param.name: millisecondsSinceUse
param.para: Discards only resources that haven't been used for greater than the specified time in milliseconds. The default is 0 milliseconds.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Creates a new device context from a Direct2D device.

param.name: options
param.para: The options to be applied to the created device context.

param.name: deviceContext
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the new device context.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The new device context will not have a selected target bitmap. The caller must create and select a bitmap as the target surface of the context.

summary.para: Creates an object that converts Direct2D primitives stored in into a fixed page representation. The print sub-system then consumes the primitives.

param.name: documentTarget
param.para: The target print job for this control.

param.name: printControlProperties
param.para: The options to be applied to the print control.

param.name: printControl
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to an object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
The print format is not supported by the document target.

remarks.para: Note This is a blocking or synchronous function and might not return immediately. How quickly this function returns depends on run-time factors such as network status, print server configuration, and printer driver implementation—factors that are difficult to predict when writing an application. Calling this function from a thread that manages interaction with the user interface could make the application appear to be unresponsive.

summary.para: Sets the maximum amount of texture memory Direct2D accumulates before it purges the image caches and cached texture allocations.

returns.para: The maximum amount of texture memory in bytes.

summary.para: Sets the maximum amount of texture memory Direct2D accumulates before it purges the image caches and cached texture allocations.

param.name: maximumInBytes
param.para: The new maximum texture memory in bytes.

remarks.para: Note Direct2D may exceed the maximum texture memory you set with this method for a single frame if necessary to render the frame.
